properties.areaDesc: Coastal Cameron; Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy; Coastal Willacy
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 3 at 10:20PM CST by NWS Brownsville TX
properties.description:
Strong south to southeast winds continue to develop across
southeast portions of deep south Texas late tonight as surface low
pressure across New Mexico and a strong low level jet across the
lower Texas coast continues to provide a strong pressure gradient
across the area. Expect south to southeast winds of 20 to 30 mph
with a few gusts to near 45 mph for the next hour or two. If these
strong winds persist...a wind advisory will be needed for portions
of deep south Texas for the rest of tonight.

Be sure to secure light weight objects, such as lawn furniture and
trash cans. Additionally, drivers of high profile vehicles are
urged to drive with caution, especially if driving on east to west
highways, flyovers, bridges, and causeways.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your local media for further
updates.

NWSheadline: Strong south to southeast winds continue to develop across eastern portions of the Rio Grande Valley late tonight
